      • displayBoard

        public static void displayBoard(java.util.List<OrderedStack<Cards>> pileBoard,
                                java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard)
        This function displays the stack of cards (displays pileBoard and columnBoard)
        Parameters:
        pileBoard - The array list of piles (c,d,h,s) for the game
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game

      • distributeCards

        public static void distributeCards(java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<Cards> deck)
        This function distributes the cards into the columnBoard (initial state of a game)
        Parameters:
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game
        deck - Array list of 52 Cards

      • cardSearch

        public static boolean cardSearch(java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard,
                                 int s,
                                 int p,
                                 int r)
        This function search for the card with a given pattern code and rank code from a column
        Parameters:
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game
        s - (int) Code for the source column (Column to search)
        p - (int) Code for the pattern (suit) of the card
        r - (int) Code for the rank of the card
        Returns:
        (boolean) Whether the card is found within the column

      • endGameCheck

        public static boolean endGameCheck(java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard)
        This function checks if the game ended or not
        Parameters:
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game
        Returns:
        (boolean) Whether the game ended or not

      • columnRotation

        public static void columnRotation(java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard,
                                  int c)
        (Cheat) This function brings the last element in the column to the front
        Parameters:
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game
        c - (int) Code for which column to perform rotation (starts from 0)

      • autoSolve

        public static void autoSolve(java.util.List<OrderedStack<Cards>> pileBoard,
                             java.util.List<java.util.Stack<Cards>> columnBoard,
                             int step)
        This function auto solves the game
        Parameters:
        pileBoard - The array list of piles (c,d,h,s) for the game
        columnBoard - The array list of columns (1~9) for the game
        step - (int) Starting from the nth step the user uses auto solve
